elements.title: Wilfried Gruhn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Wilfried Gruhn founded a centre for early childhood music learning in Freiburg, based on the Gordon music learning theory?

elements.title: Wickiup Hill (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Wickiup Hill has undocumented Native American burial grounds that are protected by Iowa law?

elements.title: Hubert Dunn (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the UK's former chief immigration adjudicator, Judge Hubert Dunn, published a book on the Irish poet Francis Ledwidge, including some previously unseen poems?

elements.title: tarmac scam (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in a typical tarmac scam someone at your door claims to be a builder working on a contract nearby with some asphalt left over, and offers a cheap deal to resurface your driveway with it?

elements.title: Northern line extension (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the tunnel boring machines that dug the London's new Northern line extension were named after the first British astronaut Helen Sharman, and British aviation pioneer Amy Johnson?

elements.title: Three's a Crowd (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the My Little Pony: Friendship Is Magic episode "Three's a Crowd" references Fear and Loathing writer Hunter S. Thompson?

elements.title: Michipicoten Provincial Park (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that archaeologists found evidence at Michipicoten Provincial Park on the north shore of Canada's Lake Superior that indigenous people used the site since at least 1100 AD?

elements.title: WMCZ (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that even the manager of Indiana radio station WMCZ confused it with WMEE, leading a federal judge to order the former to change its call sign?
